divs: sighting detailsi was sitting on my back deck looking skywards. i had my eyes trained on what looked like a particularly bright, white star very high up in the atmosphere. it was situated directly above me. i estimate that i had been looking at the object for about 45 seconds to a minute when it began to move in a slight pendulum-like motion. i thought that my percieved movement of the object was a result of atmospheric phenomena (ie. radiant cooling from the heat of the day). however, the object then moved with what looked like incredibly velocity just slightly to the left of where it had originally been located, stopped, and became completely stationary. it then began a series of extraordinarily swift start\stop movements to the right(again at what looked like an incredible speed) in a straight-line trajectory. it became stationary for another minute or so and then began manuvering (or more precisely darting) left to right\up and down in very sudden and precise movements. if i could best describe the movement of the object, i would say that its movements were almost geometric in nature. it then became stationary again and small spherical pulses of light began to appear and then dissapate around the craft. about 3 to 5 minutes after i witnessed the spherical pulses around the object, another object appeared overhead moving very slowly from west to east (my backyard faces east). i did not witness the approach of this second object until it was directly above me. this object was also white and spherical in shape, but it was much bigger and brighter than the first object. it also looked to be situated at a lower altitude than the first object. it became stationary almost directly overhead. the second object then gave off an incredible pulse of bright, white light. the pulse came directly from the object itself. it seemed to expand to twice it's original size and then shrank back to it's initial size a few seconds later. it then began to move left to right\up and down a in highly erratic fashion exactly like the first object. i watched both objects alternate between movement and non-movement for about 35 minutes before both objects lined up in an exact straight line from west to east. they then became completely stationary again. once stationary, i witnessed small spherical pulses of light appear and dissapate around both objects for another 5 minutes. at around the forty minute mark both objects shot off towards the northeast and i lost sight of both as the northeast corner of my backyard is heavily wooded with tall trees. as for how i feel about witnessing this incredible phenomenon, i'm not quite sure exactly what to think. i work in the field of science and i am, by nature, a skeptical individual. my first instinct is to engage research. however, what i saw last night i may never be able to explain away in an emperical fashion. i think i am going to have to accept that not everything on this earth can be explained.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in New Brunswick
There were no other sightings in New Brunswick on or around August 21st 2009
Summary: Two spherical shaped objects, very high in altitude making quick, sharp aerodynamic movements and giving off pulses of light.
